images.title: A royal view
images.caption: Kings Mountain, Chugach Mountains, Alaska
images.copyrightonly: © Chris Moore - Exploring Light Photography/TANDEM Stills + Motion
images.desc: Kings Mountain in Alaska's Chugach Mountains isn't just another bump on the horizon—it's the kind of rugged beauty that makes you slow down and stare. Rising over 5,800 feet and sitting roughly 22 miles northeast of Palmer, this peak towers over mile 75 of the Glenn Highway, a route famous for its dramatic scenery. Its slopes bear the marks of ancient glaciers, etched into ridges and valleys that seem tailor-made for adventure.
